Package org.opensextant.giscore.utils

Class SimpleObjectInputStream

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.utils.SimpleObjectInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class SimpleObjectInputStream extends Object implements Closeable
Simplified stream that doesn't hold object references on input. This class replaces java.io.ObjectInputStream with a stream-lined implementation. An SimpleObjectInputStream deserializes primitive data and objects previously written using an SimpleObjectOutputStream.

SimpleObjectInputStream is used to recover the state of those objects previously serialized. Other uses include passing objects between hosts using a socket stream or for marshaling and unmarshaling arguments and parameters in a remote communication system or caching to disk.

Only objects that support the IDataSerializable interface can be read from streams.

The method readObject is used to read an object from the stream.

Primitive data types can be read from the stream using the appropriate method on DataInput.

Author:
DRAND

    • readObject

      @Nullable public @Nullable Object readObject() throws ClassNotFoundException, IOException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Read the next object from the stream
      Returns:
      the next object, or null if the stream is empty.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class cannot be located
      IllegalAccessException - if the class or its nullary constructor is not accessible.
      InstantiationException - if this Class represents an abstract class, an interface, an array class, a primitive type, or void; or if the class has no nullary constructor; or if the instantiation fails for some other reason.
      IllegalStateException - if cannot determine the class to instantiate

    • readObjectCollection

      @Nullable public @Nullable List<? extends IDataSerializable> readObjectCollection() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Read a collection of objects from the stream. Note that SimpleObjectOutputStream.writeObjectCollection(java.util.Collection<? extends org.opensextant.giscore.utils.IDataSerializable>) makes no difference if the original list was null or empty so must use readNonNullObjectCollection() instead if expecting a non-null list.
      Returns:
      the collection of object, may be null
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      ClassNotFoundException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException

    • readNonNullObjectCollection

      public <T> List<T> readNonNullObjectCollection() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Read a collection of objects from the stream and return a non-null List. This method reverses the effects of SimpleObjectOutputStream.writeObjectCollection(java.util.Collection<? extends org.opensextant.giscore.utils.IDataSerializable>) where empty Lists are indistinguishable from null objects. Use this method rather than readObjectCollection() when implementing IDataSerializable.readData(org.opensextant.giscore.utils.SimpleObjectInputStream) for non-nullable List objects.
      Returns:
      the collection of objects or an empty list of target type if serialized list was null, never null
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      ClassNotFoundException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException

    • readEnum

      @Nullable public @Nullable Enum readEnum(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends Enum> enumClass) throws IOException
      Read an enumeration value from the data stream.

      The following example illustrates writing and reading an enumeration value: 

      
	import org.opensextant.giscore.events.Style.ListItemType;
	// ...
	ListItemType listItemType = ListItemType.checkHideChildren;
	SimpleObjectOutputStream out = ...
	// write enumeration value:
	out.writeEnum(listItemType);
	// ...
	SimpleObjectInputStream in = ...
	// read back the enumeration value from SimpleObjectInputStream
	listItemType = (ListItemType)in.readEnum(ListItemType.class);
      Parameters:
      enumClass - Target enumeration class, never null
      Returns:
      the next Enum value, null if the enumeration value was originally null or if the saved ordinal index isn't in range of the Enumeration.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      NullPointerException - if enumClass is null

    • readScalar

      @Nullable public @Nullable Object readScalar() throws IOException

      Throws:

      UnsupportedOperationException - if encounters an unknown type
